Class: FormValidator

FormValidator

new FormValidator()

Represents a form validator.
Source:
  • FormValidator.js, line 10

Methods

addFieldValidator(validatorName, fieldValidator) → {FormValidator}

Stores a reusable field validator for use by rules contained within this validator.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
validatorName string Name by which to retrieve validators.
fieldValidator function Field validator to store.

fieldNames() → {Array.<string>}

Retrieves a list of all field names stored by this validator.

Returns:
Type
Array.<string>

fieldValidator(validatorName) → {function}

Retrieves a reusable field validator by its name. The validator returned will retrieve the internal validator upon calling it, allowing rules to evaluate validators added after the rules were created.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
validatorName string Name of validator to retrieve.
Source:
  • FormValidator.js, line 37
Returns:
Type
function

hasFieldValidator(validatorName) → {Boolean}

Checks of the form validator contains a field validator.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
validatorName string Name of validator to retrieve.
Source:
  • FormValidator.js, line 49
Returns:
Type
Boolean

validate(form) → {Validation}

Validates all rules on all fields stored in this validation, using only the reusable validators stored in this validation, against form data structured as: { "fieldName": "fieldValue" }.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
form Object Form data to validate.
Source:
  • FormValidator.js, line 82

Type
